title: Multi-Dimensional Quality Assessment for Text-to-3D Assets: Dataset and Model
author: Kang Fu (Shanghai Jiao Tong University), Huiyu Duan (Shanghai Jiao Tong University), Zicheng Zhang (Shanghai Jiao Tong University), Xiaohong Liu (Shanghai Jiao Tong University), Xiongkuo Min (Shanghai Jiao Tong University), Jia Wang (Shanghai Jiao Tong University), Guangtao Zhai (Shanghai Jiao Tong University), ...
relevance_why: The evaluation methods and dataset established in this paper could inform quality assessment strategies relevant to audio asset generation and enhance multi-modal generative models.
background: Assessing the quality of generated 3D assets from textual descriptions, focusing on quality, authenticity, and text-asset correspondence.
contribution: This paper introduces the AIGC-T23DAQA database and a comprehensive assessment model to evaluate text-to-3D assets, achieving improved alignment with human subjective judgments.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing assessments typically rely on 2D evaluation metrics that do not effectively capture unique features of 3D assets.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work integrates projection videos and multi-modal features to provide a tailored evaluation approach for 3D asset quality.

key_innovation: Utilizes a projection-based evaluation method that extracts 3D shape, texture, and text-asset correspondence features to predict quality scores.
real_world_impact: This work could significantly streamline the process of selecting high-quality 3D assets in creative industries like gaming and filmmaking.
limitations: No specific limitations were mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.AIGC: **Artificial Intelligence Generated Content** refers to content created using artificial intelligence technologies.
new_terms.T23DA: **Text-to-3D Asset** is a type of asset generated by translating textual descriptions into three-dimensional models.

open_sourcing: The AIGC-T23DAQA database is publicly available at https://github.com/ZedFu/T23DAQA.
